title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Each military installation selected for closure or substantial realignment under a base closure law shall be designated as an enterprise zone by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The designated enterprise zone shall include the local community within the jurisdiction of the military installation. Additionally, the Secretary of Commerce shall designate the military installation as a redevelopment area. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas under the Public Works and Economic Development Act. Designations must be made within 60 days of a closure recommendation in a base closure report to Congress. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas under the Public Works and Economic Development Act within 60 days of a closure recommendation in a base closure report to Congress. Enterprise zones designated under this act are additional to the 100 enterprise zones authorized under another law. Enterprise zones designated under this act are in addition to the 100 enterprise zones authorized under another law. The course of action for designated enterprise zones may be funded from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce for economic adjustment or community planning in connection with military installation closure or realignment. Military installations can be designated as redevelopment areas under this act. The Secretary of Commerce provides economic adjustment or community planning assistance for military installation closure or realignment. Designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area remains in effect for 5 years. The Secretary conducts annual reviews and may terminate or modify the designation if requirements are not met. The term "base closure law" refers to the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990. The term "substantial realignment" in this section refers to a significant reduction in the operation of a military installation where 50 percent or more of personnel are reassigned to another military installation. SEC. 2. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Section 501(a) of the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certain certifications are met regarding commercial use considerations. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act restricts the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certifications are met regarding commercial and redevelopment uses.
